Dear Mr. Khan:  
     I like what you are doing. However, I have a better way to calculate the Real GDP:
     $15,294.3 bn/ REAL GDP = 102.5/100
 Since the product of the Means = product of the extremes, We have:
     $15,294.3 X 100 = REAL GDP X 102.5 Divide each side by 102.5  This gives us:
     $15,294.3 X 100/102.5 = REAL GDP 
     $14,921.26 = REAL GDP 2011 or rounded = $14,921.3 bn
Best Regards,
Robert Del Rosso    rdelrosso2001@yahoo.com
Keep these video coming! I'm in macro right now in college and the professor is absolutely terrible.
